title: YARD / HANGED MAN BOOTS
description: If Kim is not there, you can take off the boots once the body is down.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I thought we decided to leave it t..."
dialogueTree.text: "I thought we decided to leave it to Processing." The lieutenant shakes his head. "Let's not turn this into some kind of circus."

links.title: Interfacing: "Damn it, this is turning into some..."
links.text: Damn it, this is turning into some sort of mega-puzzle.

links.title: Logic: "Okay, so you can *sneak* out of you..."
links.text: Okay, so you can *sneak* out of your room maybe, after he's gone asleep...

dialogueTree.title: The Hanged Man: "The body is reluctant to let go of..."
dialogueTree.text: The body is reluctant to let go of the boots -- as though they were its last bit of dignity.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You're going to need to summon all..."
links.text: You're going to need to summon all your strength for this undertaking.

links.title: Ice Bear Fridge: "Whatever you're planning to do, you..."
links.text: Whatever you're planning to do, you need to do it before you catch pneumonia in the cold draft coming from deep inside the fridge.

links.title: You: "Pull on the right boot."
links.text: Pull on the right boot.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "It's not completely useless. You're..."
links.text: It's not completely useless. You're able to reveal a little more of the putrid polymer sock beneath the boot.

links.title: Interfacing: "Just relax. This is easy. This is *..."
links.text: Just relax. This is easy. This is *happening*.

links.title: Empathy: "See? The corpse doesn't care if you..."
links.text: See? The corpse doesn't care if you try to take his boots. He doesn't need them. He's probably *glad* to get rid of them.

links.title: You: "Pick up the body and try to shake t..."
links.text: Pick up the body and try to shake the boots off.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "It's heavier than you'd think. You'..."
links.text: It's heavier than you'd think. You're forced to drop it back down immediately. The corpse lands on the ground with a nauseating thud, looking even sadder than before.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Damn, you're out of shape... In you..."
links.text: Damn, you're out of shape... In your defence, the corpse *was* quite slippery.

links.title: You: "Step on the corpse as you pull on t..."
links.text: Step on the corpse as you pull on the boots.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Something cracks in the left leg --..."
links.text: Something cracks in the left leg -- it really is about to come off. The leg, I mean. Not the boot.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "You may want to slow down. Don't te..."
links.text: You may want to slow down. Don't tear into it like that.

links.title: You: "Adjust his seating position first."
links.text: Adjust his seating position first.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "He's too heavy to move by yourself..."
links.text: He's too heavy to move by yourself -- a great mass of dead muscles, with hoarfrost covering his milky eyes.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Is that an accusatory glance he gav..."
links.text: Is that an accusatory glance he gave you? No... no, he's cool.

links.title: You: "Try to twist the boots off one by o..."
links.text: Try to twist the boots off one by one.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "This is the right method. It takes..."
links.text: This is the right method. It takes some time, but eventually the boots come off -- with nasty slices of polymer sock stuck to even bigger pieces of skin and rotting flesh.

links.title: You: "Take stock of the damage."
links.text: Take stock of the damage.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Not good. Let's pin this on the bea..."
links.text: Not good. Let's pin this on the bear -- the ice bear tore up his legs with its claws. As for the boots -- you can't possibly do anything with them until you have cleaned and *disinfected* them thoroughly.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Yes. These absolutely need to be wa..."
links.text: Yes. These absolutely need to be washed before. The stink is incredible.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Didn't the Whirling have a kitchen?"
links.text: Didn't the Whirling have a kitchen?

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The legs look like they've been cla..."
links.text: The legs look like they've been clawed at by wild animals. As for the boots -- you can't possibly do anything with them until you have cleaned and *disinfected* them thoroughly.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Yes. These absolutely need to be wa..."
links.text: Yes. These absolutely need to be washed before. The stink is incredible.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Didn't the Whirling have a kitchen?"
links.text: Didn't the Whirling have a kitchen?

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Look -- he's skinning the fucker u..."
links.text: "Look -- he's skinning the fucker up good. *Puukko* style."

links.title: Cuno: ""Hell. Keep at it, pig!""
links.text: "Hell. Keep at it, pig!"

links.title: You: "Pull on the left boot."
links.text: Pull on the left boot.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "It feels like the leg is going to c..."
links.text: It feels like the leg is going to come off along with the boot, but you are able to get the boot to move a centimetre or two.

links.title: Cuno: ""Whoah. Cuno's little *sneak-pig's*..."
links.text: "Whoah. Cuno's little *sneak-pig's* back for the booty... "

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Yeah, fuck it to pieces for us. Li..."
links.text: "Yeah, fuck it to pieces for us. Liar cop!"

dialogueTree.title: The Hanged Man: "Before you can grab hold of the boo..."
dialogueTree.text: Before you can grab hold of the boot, you hear a voice coming out of the dead man's mouth. It's the voice of Lieutenant Kim Kitsuragi, telling you to stop whatever you're doing.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "You're sabotaging the crime scene,..."
links.text: You're sabotaging the crime scene, and yet you haven't even finished the field autopsy. Come back later when you're done with the investigation.
